channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Company that has distributed millions of personality tests shares 4 potential questions, and what they will and won’t reveal
item.description: An expert said not all personality assessments are created equal, and provides some legitimate questions to plan ahead for.

item.title: The ‘next important test for AI bulls’ happens this week with Nvidia’s earnings
$80 million for a CEO-in-waiting? Banks are paying top dollar to keep talent
item.description: Goldman Sachs awarded its COO, widely viewed to be the next CEO, an $80 million retention bonus if he stays for five more years.

item.title: U.S. stocks are near record highs. Why are investors so worried?
xAI chief engineer blames former OpenAI employee after Grok blocks results saying Musk and Trump ‘spread misinformation’
item.description: xAI is blaming a former Open-AI employee after Grok briefly censored responses about Elon Musk and Donald Trump.

item.title: Stock investors stopped freaking out over rates. Now this threat is re-emerging.
When Warren Buffett bought an obscure RV maker he promised to pay the CEO whatever he asked—it’s not a tactic Buffett recommends, but the gamble paid off
item.description: Warren Buffett says not many people will know the name Pete Liegl, a "one-of-a-kind" founder and CEO who contributed billions to the Berkshire Hathawa...

item.title: Food-delivery companies jump after Prosus deal for Just Eat Takeaway

item.description: How two childhood friends founded the ‘next Crowdstrike,’ now valued at $5 billion.
